title: Statistical Methods for Psychologists
text: statpsych implements confidence interval sample size methods especially useful psychological research. methods can applied 1-group, 2-group, paired-samples, multiple-group designs variety parameters including means, medians, proportions, slopes, standardized mean differences, standardized linear contrasts means, plus several measures correlation association. confidence intervals sample size functions applicable single parameters well differences, ratios, linear contrasts parameters. sample size functions can used approximate sample size needed estimate parameter function parameters desired confidence interval precision perform variety hypothesis tests (directional two-sided, equivalence, superiority, noninferiority) desired power. details, see: https://dgbonett.sites.ucsc.edu/.

what: Computes confidence intervals for a 3-rater design with dichotomous ratings — ci.agree.3rater
title: Computes confidence intervals for a 3-rater design with dichotomous ratings — ci.agree.3rater
text: Computes adjusted Wald confidence intervals G-index agreement pairs raters 3-rater design dichotomous rating, computes adjusted Wald confidence intervals differences pairs G agreement. adjusted Wald confidence interval unanimous G agreement among three raters also computed. three-rater design, unanimous G agreement equal average pairs G agreement. G-index corrects chance agreement.

text: alpha alpha level 1-alpha confidence f vector frequency counts 2x2x2 table f = [ f111, f112, f121, f122, f211, f212, f221, f222 ], first subscript represents rating rater 1, second subscript represents rating rater 2, third subscript represents rating rater 3

title: Computes confidence intervals for a 3-rater design with dichotomous ratings — ci.agree.3rater
text: Returns 7-row matrix. rows : G(1,2): G-index raters 1 2 G(1,3): G-index raters 1 3 G(2,3): G-index raters 2 3 G(1,2)-G(1,3): difference G(1,2) G(1,3) G(1,2)-G(2,3): difference G(1,2) G(2,3) G(2,3)-G(1,3): difference G(2,3) G(1,3) G(3): G-index unanimous agreement three raters columns : Estimate - estimate G-index (two-rater, difference, unanimous) LL - lower limit adjusted Wald confidence interval UL - upper limit adjusted Wald confidence interval

what: Bayesian credible interval for a Pearson or partial correlation with a skeptical prior — ci.bayes.cor
title: Bayesian credible interval for a Pearson or partial correlation with a skeptical prior — ci.bayes.cor
text: Computes approximate Bayesian credible interval Pearson partial correlation skeptical prior. skeptical prior distribution Normal mean 0 small standard deviation. skeptical prior assumes population correlation within range small values (-r r). skeptic 95% confident population correlation -r r, prior standard deviation can set r/1.96. correlation less .2 absolute value typically considered "small", prior standard deviation set .2/1.96. correlation value considered small depend application. Set s = 0 Pearson correlation.

title: Bayesian credible interval for a Pearson or partial correlation with a skeptical prior — ci.bayes.cor
Bayesian credible interval for a Pearson or partial correlation with a skeptical prior — ci.bayes.cor
text: alpha alpha level 1-alpha credibility interval prior_sd standard deviation skeptical prior distribution cor estimated Pearson partial correlation s number control variables n sample size

title: Bayesian credible interval for a Pearson or partial correlation with a skeptical prior — ci.bayes.cor
text: Returns 1-row matrix. columns : Posterior mean - posterior mean (Bayesian estimate correlation) LL - lower limit credible interval UL - upper limit credible interval

title: Bayesian credible interval for a Pearson or partial correlation with a skeptical prior — ci.bayes.cor
code: ci.bayes.cor(.05, .1, .536, 0, 50) #>  Posterior mean         LL        UL #>       0.1873765 0.02795441 0.3375031  # Should return: # Posterior mean         LL        UL #      0.1873765 0.02795441 0.3375031  ci.bayes.cor(.05, .1, .536, 0, 300) #>  Posterior mean        LL        UL #>       0.4195068 0.3352449 0.4971107  # Should return: #  Posterior mean        LL        UL #       0.4195068 0.3352449 0.4971107

what: Simulates confidence interval coverage probability for a Pearson correlation — sim.ci.cor
title: Simulates confidence interval coverage probability for a Pearson correlation — sim.ci.cor
text: Performs computer simulation confidence interval performance Pearson correlation. bias adjustment used reduce bias Fisher transformed Pearson correlation. Sample data can generated bivariate population distributions five different marginal distributions. distributions scaled standard deviations 1.0. Bivariate random data specified marginal skewness kurtosis generated using unonr function mnonr package.

title: Simulates confidence interval coverage probability for a Pearson correlation — sim.ci.cor
code: sim.ci.cor(alpha, n, cor, dist1, dist2, rep)

title: Simulates confidence interval coverage probability for a Pearson correlation — sim.ci.cor
text: alpha alpha level 1-alpha confidence n sample size cor population Pearson correlation dist1 type distribution variable 1 (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) dist2 type distribution variable 2 (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) 1 = Gaussian (skewness = 0 excess kurtosis = 0) 2 = platykurtic (skewness = 0 excess kurtosis = -1.2) 3 = leptokurtic (skewness = 0 excess kurtosis = 6) 4 = moderate skew (skewness = 1 excess kurtosis = 1.5) 5 = large skew (skewness = 2 excess kurtosis = 6) rep number Monte Carlo samples

title: Simulates confidence interval coverage probability for a Pearson correlation — sim.ci.cor
text: Returns 1-row matrix. columns : Coverage - probability confidence interval including population correlation Lower Error - probability lower limit greater population correlation Upper Error - probability upper limit less population correlation Ave CI Width - average confidence interval width

title: Simulates confidence interval coverage probability for a Pearson correlation — sim.ci.cor
code: sim.ci.cor(.05, 30, .7, 4, 5, 1000) #>      Coverage Lower Error Upper Error Ave CI Width #> [1,]    0.934       0.043       0.023    0.3908387  # Should return (within sampling error): #      Coverage Lower Error Upper Error Ave CI Width # [1,]  0.93815     0.05125      0.0106    0.7778518

text: Computes sample size group required test difference population proportions desired power (using continuity correction) 2-group design. function requires planning values proportions. Set proportion planning value .5 conservatively large sample size requirement. function require planning value proportion difference (effect size) equal difference two proportion planning values; example, planning value proportion difference set equal minimally interesting effect size.

what: Test of a monotonic trend in means for an ordered between-subjects factor — test.mono.mean.bs
title: Test of a monotonic trend in means for an ordered between-subjects factor — test.mono.mean.bs
text: Computes simultaneous confidence intervals adjacent pairwise comparisons population means using estimated group means, estimated group standard deviations, samples sizes input. Equal variances assumed. Satterthwaite adjustment degrees freedom used improve accuracy confidence intervals. one lower limits greater 0 upper limit less 0, conclude population means monotonic decreasing. one upper limits less 0 lower limits greater 0, conclude population means monotonic increasing. Reject hypothesis monotonic trend lower limit greater 0 upper limit less 0.

statpsych version 1.8.0 (Release date: 2025/06/xx)
text: Changes: test.mono.median.bs – Hypothesis test monotonic trend medians ordered -subjects factor ci.slope.median.bs – Computes confidence interval slope medians one-factor experimental design quantitative -subjects factor size.ci.cv – Computes sample size coefficient variation confidence interval 1-group design size.ci.median – Computes sample size median confidence interval 1-group design size.ci.median2 – Computes sample size median difference confidence interval 2-group design size.ci.lc.median.bs – Computes sample size linear contrast medians confidence interval -subjects design size.ci.gen – Computes sample size confidence interval type parameter 1-group design size.ci.gen2 – Computes sample size confidence interval difference type parameter 2-group design size.test.gen – Computes sample size test type parameter 1-group design size.test.gen2 – Computes sample size test difference type parameter 2-group design ci.prop now adds exact confidence interval ci.mean1 replaced ci.mean ci.prop1 replaced ci.prop ci.median1 replaced ci.median ci.stdmean1 replaced ci.stdmean pi.var.upper replaced pi.var

title: statpsych version 1.7.0 (Release date: 2024/12/17)
text: CRAN release: 2024-12-18 Changes: size.ci.oddsratio – Computes sample size odds ratio confidence interval size.ci.yule – Computes sample size Yule’s Q confidence interval size.ci.phi – Computes sample size phi correlation confidence interval size.ci.biphi – Computes sample size biserial-phi correlation confidence interval size.ci.ancova2 – Computes sample size 2-group ANCOVA confidence interval size.ci.slope.gen – Computes sample size slope coefficient confidence interval general model size.test.ancova2 – Computes sample size 2-group ANCOVA hypothesis test size.test.slope.gen – Computes sample size slope coefficient hypothesis test general model signal – Computes parameter estimates Yes/signal detection study exp.slope – Computes confidence intervals exp(B) 100(exp(B) - 1)% ci.bayes.cor – Computes Bayesian credible interval Pearson partial correlation skeptical prior ci.bayes.spcor – Computes Bayesian credible interval semipartial correlation skeptical prior pi.var – Computes one-sided two-sided prediction limits estimated variance future study (replace pi.var.upper) size.ci.prop2 can now solve equal unequal sample sizes. Requires new argumnet, R, specifying ratio sample sizes now returns 2-column matrix. size.ci.ratio.prop2 can now solve equal unequal sample sizes. Requires new argument, R, specifying ratio sample sizes now returns 2-column matrix. size.test.cor2 can now solve equal unequal sample sizes. Requires new argument, R, specifying ratio sample sizes, returns 2-column matrix pi.cor now options one-sided two-sided prediction limits. requires new argument, type pi.prop now options one-sided two-sided prediction limits. requires new argument, type definition subscripts ci.2x2.mean.mixed, ci.2x2.median.mixed, ci.2x2.stdmean.mixed functions changed first subscript now specifies factor second subscript specified factor B. ci.2x2.stdmean.mixed – corrected error standard error computation size.test.lc.ancova – corrected minor error sample size formula

title: statpsych version 1.6.0 (Release date: 2024/07/08)
text: CRAN release: 2024-07-09 Changes: ci.mean.fpc – Computes confidence interval mean finite population correction ci.prop.fpc – Computes confidence interval proportion finite population correction ci.poisson – Computes confidence interval Poisson rate ci.ratio.poisson2 – Computes confidence interval ratio Poisson rates 2-group design ci.bscor – Computes confidence interval biserial correlation pi.cor – Computes prediction interval estimated correlation pi.prop – Computes prediction interval estimated proportion test.cor – Hypothesis test Pearson partial correlation (zero non-zero null hypotheses) test.spear – Hypothesis test Spearman correlation (zero non-zero null hypotheses) test.cor2 – Hypothesis test 2-group Pearson partial correlation difference test.spear2 – Hypothesis test 2-group Spearman correlation difference test.mean – Hypothesis test mean using summary information size.ci.cor2 – Computes sample size 2-group Pearson correlation difference confidence interval size.ci.spear2 – Computes sample size 2-group Spearman correlation difference confidence interval size.ci.tetra – Computes sample size tetrachoric correlation confidence interval size.ci.mean.prior – Computes sample size mean confidence interval using planning value prior study size.ci.prop.prior – Computes sample size proportion confidence interval using planning value prior study size.ci.cor.prior – Computes sample size correlation confidence interval using planning value prior study adj.se – Computes adjusted standard errors slope coefficients exploratory analysis fitindices – Computes four SEM fit indices ci.var.upper now computes exact upper limit rather approximate upper limit power computations now accurate small effect sizes power.cor, power.cor2, power.lc.meanc.bs, power.mean, power.mean2, power.mean.ps, power.prop, power.pro2, power.prop.ps functions size.test.prop size.test.prop2 now assume test statistic use continuity correction one-group function names end “1” renamed now exclude “1” (naming consistency avoid confusion lower case L). ci.mape2 renamed ci.ratio.mape2, ci.cod2 renamed ci.ratio.cod2 ci.phi function now uses Fisher transformation improved coverage probability performance

title: statpsych version 1.5.0 (Release date: 2023/12/11)

means ci.2x2.median.bs – Computes confidence intervals effects 2x2 -subjects design medians pi.var.upper – Computes upper prediction limit estimated variance ci.bayes.normal – Computes Bayesian credible interval parameter estimator normal sampling distributuion using Normal prior distribution ci.bayes.prop1 – Computes Bayesian credible interval single proportion using Beta prior distribution Corrected Example output ci.reliability ci.prop.ps SE added output : ci.cronbach, ci.oddsratio, ci.yule, ci.etasqr, ci.rsqr, ci.spear2, ci.cor2, ci.cor.dep, ci.cod1, ci.mad1, ci.mape, ci.agree2, ci.pbcor, ci.tetra Improved accuracy size.ci.rsqr Three generalized Yule coefficients added ci.yule ci.prop.ps, ci.ratio.prop.ps, ci.2x2.prop.mixed functions now define proportions y = 1 category rather y = 0 category.

title: statpsych v1.3.0 (Release date: 2023/01/01)
text: CRAN release: 2023-01-11 Changes: ci.theil – Theil-Sen estimate confidence interval slope sim.ci.median2 – Simulates confidence interval coverage probability median difference two-group design sim.ci.median.ps – Simulates confidence interval coverage probability median difference paired design sim.ci.stdmean2 – Simulates confidence interval coverage probability standardized mean difference two-group design pi.score.ps – Prediction interval difference scores 2-level within-subjects experiment ci.cod1 – first column ‘Estimate’, longer ‘COD’ ci.cod2 – first column ‘Estimate’, longer ‘COD1’ ci.cramer – first column ‘Estimate’, longer ‘Cramer’s V’ ci.lc.stdmean.bs – now returns 3 rows, adding sample size group 1 standardizer ci.lc.stdmean.ws – now returns two rows, one standardizer ci.mad1 – first column ‘Estimate’, longer ‘MAD’ ci.mape – first column ‘Estimate’, longer ‘MAPE’ size.ci.lc.stdmean.bs – now returns two rows, one standardizer size.ci.lc.stdmean.ws – now returns two rows, one standardizer size.ci.stdmean2 – now returns two rows, one standardizer size.ci.stdmean.ps – now returns two rows, one standardizer ci.mann – now returns confidence interval P(y1 > y2) rather P(y1 < y2).

title: statpsych v1.2.0 (Release date: 2022/08/15)
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-19 Changes: ci.cramer - Confidence interval Cramer’s V ci.2x2.mean.bs - Confidence intervals effects 2x2 -subjects design means ci.2x2.mean.ws - Confidence intervals effects 2x2 within-subjects design means ci.2x2.mean.mixed - Confidence intervals effects 2x2 mixed design means ci.2x2.prop.bs - Confidence intervals effects 2x2 -subjects design proportions ci.2x2.prop.mixed - Confidence intervals effects 2x2 mixed design proportions sim.ci.mean1 – Simulation confidence interval mean sim.ci.mean2 – Simulation confidence interval mean difference two-group design sim.ci.mean.ps – Simulation confidence interval mean difference paired-samples design sim.ci.median1 – Simulation confidence interval single median sim.ci.cor – Simulation confidence interval Pearson correlation sim.ci.spear – Simulation confidence interval Spearman correlation ci.prop.ps function now outputs adjusted point estimate proportion difference, stated documentation, rather unadjusted estimate ci.cor, ci.cor2, ci.cor.dep functions now uses bias adjustment reduce bias Fisher transformed correlations ci.median1 function now uses standard error formula ci.median2, ci.ratio.median2, ci.median.ps functions ci.indirect – Corrected error standard error computation

title: statpsych v1.1.0 (Release date: 2022/06/30)
text: CRAN release: 2022-06-22 Changes: ci.agree2 - Confidence interval G-index difference 2-group design ci.cod2 - Confidence interval ratio dispersion coefficients 2-group ci.etasqr - Confidence interval eta-squared ci.lc.gen.bs - Confidence interval linear contrast parameters -subjects design ci.lc.glm - Confidence interval linear contrast general linear model parameters ci.reliability - Confidence interval reliability coefficient ci.rsqr - Confidence interval squared multiple correlation ci.sign1 - Confidence interval parameter one-sample sign test ci.slope.mean.bs - Confidence interval slope means single-factor design quantitative -subjects factor test.kurtosis - Computes Monte Carlo p-value test excess kurtosis test.skew - Computes Monte Carlo p-value test skewness test.mono.mean.bs - Test monotonic trend means ordered -subjects factor test.mono.prop.bs - Test monotonic trend proportions ordered -subjects etasqr.gen.2way - Computes generalized eta-squared estimates two-factor design Updated documentation consistency size.test.cronbach now takes (alpha, pow, rel, r, h) rather (alpha, pow, rel, , h) ci.cronbach now takes (alpha, rel, r, n) rather (alpha, rel, , n) ci.median.ps, last column now “COV” rather “cov”
